critique: This executive order pertains to the Panama Canal during wartime, specifically mandating a gangway watch on vessels to control access and prevent unauthorized individuals from boarding or leaving. It enhances security measures during wartime. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration policy, or economic regulation. The order expands executive power in a limited scope (Canal Zone during wartime) and leans towards national security. It does not directly address social inclusion or federalism.
